meanings.definition: Capable of pulling or drawing something along.
meanings.sent1: The strong horse was very tractive and easily pulled the heavy cart.
meanings.sent2: The magnet's tractive force attracted the metal objects towards it.
meanings.sent3: The tractive tractor tried to pull the stubborn donkey along, but it refused to budge.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter had a tractive quality that drew everyone towards her.
meanings.sent5: The tractive power of the locomotive made it the perfect choice for hauling freight.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to attract or draw in.
meanings.sent1: The colorful advertisement was very tractive and caught the attention of many passersby.
meanings.sent2: The charismatic speaker had a tractive personality that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The tractive aroma of freshly baked cookies lured everyone into the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her tractive smile was like a magnet, drawing people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The tractive charm of the small town made visitors never want to leave.
